title: BengaliSent: A Large-Scale Benchmark for Bengali Sentiment Analysis Using Multilingual Transformers
subtitle: ACL Workshop on South and Southeast Asian NLP (2021)
description: We introduce BengaliSent, a manually annotated corpus of 120,000 social media posts for three-class sentiment classification. We fine-tune multilingual BERT and XLM-RoBERTa and achieve state-of-the-art F1 of 91.3%, outperforming prior work by 8.2 points.
story: This paper grew out of frustration at how little NLP tooling existed for Bengali speakers. What started as a side project became a published benchmark that other researchers continue to build on.
venue: ACL Workshop on South and Southeast Asian NLP

title: Satellite-Assisted Crop Yield Prediction for Climate-Vulnerable Agricultural Systems
subtitle: Nature Food (Under Review, 2024)
description: A multi-modal approach combining Sentinel-2 NDVI time series with meteorological station data and farmer survey inputs to predict boro rice yield at the upazila level in Bangladesh. Model achieves R² of 0.847 on held-out test set.
story: This research is the academic backbone of a project commissioned by the Bangladesh Ministry of Agriculture. The stakes — food security for 170 million people — clarified every methodological decision.

title: Building NLP for the Other 5 Billion: Lessons from Low-Resource Language Research in South Asia
subtitle: PyCon APAC 2023 — Conference Talk
description: A practitioner's account of the technical and ethical challenges of building NLP systems for languages with limited digital representation. Covers data collection strategies, model adaptation techniques, and community-centered evaluation methods.
story: This talk crystallized years of work into a coherent argument: the next frontier in AI isn't more compute, it's linguistic diversity. The room's response convinced me this was a message worth repeating.
